meanings.definition: The act of publishing something before it is officially released to the public.
meanings.sent1: Libraries often receive prepublications of books to review before they are available to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The bookstore accidentally put out prepublications of the new novel before the author's signing event.
meanings.sent3: The prepublications of the magazine were so early that they included predictions for events that hadn't even happened yet!
meanings.sent4: Her ability to predict trends in the market was like having access to prepublications of the future.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the air was palpable as the prepublications of the research findings were distributed to eager scientists.

meanings.definition: Material that is published before its official release date.
meanings.sent1: I was lucky to get my hands on prepublications of the new video game before it hit the shelves.
meanings.sent2: The leak of prepublications of the upcoming movie caused a stir among fans waiting for its premiere.
meanings.sent3: The prepublications of the cookbook were like a sneak peek into the chef's culinary secrets.
meanings.sent4: His collection of prepublications felt like a treasure trove of exclusive content waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The prepublications of the fashion line gave a glimpse into the designer's creative process before the official launch.
